Kernel/sources/input/mouse_generic_ps2.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "mouse_generic_ps2.h"
00002 #include <common.h>
00003 #include <interrupts/irq.h>
00004 #include <interrupts/idt.h>
00005 #include <interrupts/interrupt_handler.h>
00006 #include <input/devices.h>
00007 
00008 int mouse_cycle=0;     //unsigned char
00009 char mouse_byte[3];    //signed char
00010 mouse_input_t istruct;
00011 
00012 idt_call_registers_t mouseIrqCallback(idt_call_registers_t regs) 
00013 {
00014   switch(mouse_cycle)
00015   {
00016     case 0:
00017       mouse_byte[0]=inb(PORT_1);
00018       mouse_cycle++;
00019       break;
00020     case 1:
00021       mouse_byte[1]=inb(PORT_1);
00022       mouse_cycle++;
00023       break;
00024     case 2:
00025       mouse_byte[2]=inb(PORT_1);
00026       istruct.i_byte = mouse_byte[0];
00027       istruct.mouse_x = mouse_byte[1];
00028       istruct.mouse_y = mouse_byte[2];
00029       sendInputMessage(DEVICE_MOUSE, 0, &istruct);
00030       mouse_cycle=0;
00031       break;
00032   }
00033 }
00034 
00035 //Wait tell BIT_1 of PORT_1 is not set
00036 void mouseWaitOutput()
00037 {
00038 uint8 readbyte;
00039 
00040         while (1)
00041         {
00042                 readbyte = inb(PORT_1);
00043                 if (readbyte & BIT_1)
00044                 {
00045                         //BIT_1 still set
00046                 }
00047                 else
00048                 {
00049                         break;
00050                 }
00051         }
00052 
00053 
00054 }
00055 
00056 
00057 //Wait untill bit 0 of PORT_2 Is set.
00058 void mouseWaitInput()
00059 {
00060 uint8 readbyte;
00061 
00062         while (1)
00063         {
00064                 readbyte = inb(PORT_2);
00065                 if (readbyte & BIT_0)
00066                 {
00067                         //BIT_0 still set
00068                         break;
00069                 }
00070                 else
00071                 {
00072                         //0 Not set
00073                 }
00074         }
00075 
00076 
00077 }
00078 
00079 void sendMouseCommand(uint8 cmd)
00080 {
00081         mouseWaitOutput();
00082         outb(PORT_2, CMD);
00083 
00084         mouseWaitOutput();
00085         outb(PORT_1, cmd);
00086 }
00087 
00088 uint8 readMouseData()
00089 {
00090         mouseWaitInput();
00091         uint8 ret = inb(PORT_2);
00092 
00093         return ret;
00094 }
00095 
00096 void initializeMouse()
00097 {
00098         register_interrupt_handler(GET_IRQ(12), mouseIrqCallback);
00099 
00100         uint8 _status;
00101 
00102         mouseWaitOutput();
00103         outb(0x64, 0xA8); //Enable the auxillery mouse device
00104 
00105         //Enable interrupts
00106 
00107         //0x20 to 0x64 = Get compaq status byte
00108         mouseWaitOutput();
00109         outb(0x64, 0x20);
00110 
00111         //Read the value from 0x60 (The compaq status byte)
00112         mouseWaitInput();
00113         _status = inb(0x60);
00114 
00115         //Check if bit 5 is set
00116         if (_status & 0x20 == 0x20)
00117         {
00118                 //XOR 0x5 should leave bit 5 free 
00119                 _status = _status ^ 0x20;
00120         }
00121 
00122         //Set bit 1 to true
00123         _status = _status | 0x2;
00124         
00125         //Send set compaq byte command (0x60) to mouse port (0x64)
00126         mouseWaitOutput();
00127         outb(0x64, 0x60);
00128 
00129         //Send the new status to 0x60
00130         mouseWaitOutput();
00131         outb(0x60, _status);
00132 
00133         //May send a ACK or may not
00134         readMouseData(); //ACK
00135 
00136         //End of enabling interrupts
00137         
00138         sendMouseCommand(0xF6);
00139         readMouseData(); //ACK
00140         sendMouseCommand(0xF4);
00141         readMouseData(); //ACK
00142 }
